Shift4 Payments, LLC
Exhibit M
CONFIDENTIA

Security Policy

Information    Information Security Policy

Approved by:    | Date approved:
---|---
Jared Isaacman. CEO     |11.05.2019

Policy Statement
Shift4 Payments recognizes that certain information is confidential and the release of his information could cause
harm.
Purpose
Protect the financial and reputational well-being of the Company and comply with applicable legal and regulatory
requirements.
Scope
This policy applies to all Shift4 Payments employees, financial institutions, third party vendors, and anyone else
that may come in contact with Shift4 Payment’s NPI (non-public information).
Background
Shift4 Payments should minimize the amount of NPI data it stores and eliminate records when they are no longer
needed. It should have clear policies relating to how long it retains records. Under federal law, for example, a
company may not retain information for a longer period than is reasonably necessary to prevent fraud.
Policy Elements
    •   All data must be handled and labeled according to the sensitivity label.
    •   All sensitive data must be encrypted at rest and in transit in line with industry standards.
    •   All NPI must be shredded when it is no longer needed for the purpose for which it was collected or
        generated.
    •   All NPI data must have retention periods that are within those allowed by law.
Definitions
Non-public information (NPI) includes any information that could be used to cause harm,
